Action name: Micro-probing (read device's internal memory- data- keys- or program code)
RFID Tag tracking - tracing a tag through rogue readers
Obtain cryptographic keys from stolen/subverted node (e.g. Zigbee shared network key)
Node or network topology discovery: Clock skewing
Node or network topology discovery: Homing
Side channel analysis of encrypted data: Timing analysis
Side channel analysis of encrypted data: Power analysis
Side channel analysis of encrypted data: Fault analysis
Side channel analysis of encrypted data: Electromagnetic analysis
Cryptanalysis - End encryption key being used: Known-plaintext attack
Cryptanalysis - End encryption key being used: Chosen-plaintext attack
Cryptanalysis - End encryption key being used: Chosen-ciphertext attack
Cryptanalysis - End encryption key being used: Ciphertext-only attack
Man-in-the-middle - secretly relay and possibly alter communication between 2 entities/nodes
RPL Rank attack - attacker changes rank value of node to attract child nodes and a large amount of traffic going towards root node
Node replication (clone node) - existing node ID is copied to network- disrupting network performance
Node spoofing (clone ID) - malicious node clones identity of another node in order to gain access to traffic going through or arriving at victim node
Node injection (false node- impersonation) - physically deploy malicious node between nodes-controlling all data flow to and from nodes
Sybil attack - malicious node uses several identities on same physical node- allowing malware to be propagated and large parts of network to be taken under control
Spoofed- altered- or replayed routing information: Sinkhole attack
Spoofed- altered- or replayed routing information: Wormhole attack
Spoofed- altered- or replayed routing information: Create routing loop
Spoofed- altered- or replayed routing information: RPL network Version Attack
Spoofed- altered- or replayed routing information: RPL network Neighbor Attack
Acknowledgement spoofng/flooding - spoofs acknowledgements- providing false information to neighboring nodes
Replay attack - original message is intercepted- recorded- and replayed to recipient at later time
Message corruption - modification of message content
Message fabrication: Fragmentation attack - attacker takes advantage of receiver waiting for all fragments to arrive and
Message fabrication: De-synchronization - fake messages are created at one or both endpoints requesting re-transmissions
RPL network Local repair attack - attacker periodically sends local repair message- causing more overhead
RPL network DIS attack - malicious node periodically sends DIS (DODAG information solicitation) messages
Data link layer Resource exhaustion (continuous channel access)
Accessing Functionality Not Properly Constrained by ACLs
Exploiting Incorrectly Configured Access Control Security Levels
Logging Obstruction: Block Logging to Central Repository
Network Routing Obstruction: Selective forwarding (neglect and greed attack)
Network Routing Obstruction: Black hole attack
Force the System to Reset Values
Malware/malicious code Inserted Into To Product Software
Modify- insert- or delete data in processing and storage
Physical removal- disabling- incapacitation- or destruction of device or Component
